Activity: Wake up, contemplate the absurdity of existence while making coffee. Check emails - anything urgent? If not, browse Hacker News for 30 minutes.
Quickly review the week's goals: module completion, integration, bug fixes, and documentation. Think about the most efficient way to tackle them. Probably start with the most annoying module first.
Focus on the software module I hate the most (Module A): Start development/testing of the core functionality of Module A. Ugh.
Realize Module A is even worse than I thought. Email @larch-1, @qres-1 about a specific calculation that seems fishy. Subject: Module A - WTF is this calculation?
Continue working on Module A while waiting for a response. Implement unit tests alongside development – avoid future headaches.
Lunch. Escape the office. Find a decent sandwich shop and people-watch. Avoid work talk.

Back to the grind. Still no reply. Decide to make a best-guess assumption about the calculation and proceed. Add a HUGE comment block highlighting the assumption and emailing @larch-1 and @qres-1 again. Subject: URGENT - Module A Calculation Assumption
Finish the core functionality of Module A. Begin writing basic documentation (just enough to remember what the heck I did).
Finally got reply from @larch-1 and @qres-1 confirming my assumption. Remove the 'HUGE comment block' and replace it with the correct formula.
Start the testing process for Module A. Fix the bugs. Found 2 bugs. Fix them.
Leave the office. Go home and play video games to de-stress.
